Package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.model.domain

Class Ecosystem

java.lang.Object
edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.model.domain.Ecosystem
public class Ecosystem extends Object
Encapsulates (for simulation) a simple intransitive ecosystem—as exemplified by certain E. coli ecosystems, competition between male side-blotched lizards, and the game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The ecosystem in this model supports any odd int number (at least 3) of breeds, and assumes equal strength between breeds—both in initial populations and in competitive interactions.

Key

  • Individuals in this ecosystem do not move, but are placed in all cells of a grid (or points of a lattice); this is the terrain of the ecosystem.
  • In each iteration of the simulation, a random individual is selected, along with one of that individual's 4 immediately adjacent neighbors (i.e., in the Von Neumann neighborhood), also selected at random.
  • If the two selected individuals are of the same breed, then there is no change; otherwise, the loser of the competition between the two (e.g., rock losing to paper) is replaced by a copy of the winner.
  • Optionally, competitive interaction may be preceded (with a specified probability) by random selection of two (not necessarily adjacent) individuals, with the selected individuals trading locations in the terrain.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ecosystem

      public Ecosystem(int numBreeds, int size, boolean toroidal, @NonNull Random rng)
      Initializes this instance with the specified number of breeds, terrain size, and terrain topology. Since selection of individuals for competition is stochastic, a source of randomness must also be provided.
      Parameters:
      numBreeds - Number of distinct breeds to populate the ecosystem.
      size - Terrain height and width.
      toroidal - Flag specifying whether terrain is toroidal (with wrapping edges) or a box (with closed edges).
      rng - Source of randomness.

  • Method Details

    • iterate

      public boolean iterate(float swapProbability)
      Executes a single iteration of the simulation. This consists of possible random selection (with likelihood specified by swapProbability of a pair of individuals to swap locations, followed by random selection of an individual and one of its neighbors for competitive interaction.
      Parameters:
      swapProbability - Probability of preceding competitive interaction by swapping a randomly selected pair of individuals.
      Returns:
      Flag indicating whether competitive interaction resulted in a replacement of an individual (true) or no change (false).

    • iterate

      public int iterate(int numIterations, float swapProbability)
      Invokes iterate(float) repeatedly, numIteration times, and returns the count of those iterations in which a competitive interaction resulted in replacement of one individual by a copy of the other.
      Parameters:
      numIterations - Number of invocations of iterate(float) to perform.
      swapProbability - Likelihood of a randomly selected pair of individuals trading places in each iteration.
      Returns:
      Number of iterations resulting in a change in population sizes.

    • getInitialBreedCount

      public int getInitialBreedCount()
      Returns the initial number of breeds in the simulation.

    • getCurrentBreedCount

      public int getCurrentBreedCount()
      Returns the current extant (surviving) number of breeds in the simulation.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the height and width of the ecosystem's terrain.

    • isToroidal

      public boolean isToroidal()
      Returns a flag indicating the terrain's topology, where true denotes toroidal, and false denotes a box with closed sides.

    • getTerrain

      public int[][] getTerrain()
      Returns the contents of the terrain. This is a safe copy, in the sense that any changes made to it by a consumer of this method will not reflect the underlying simulation. However, for simulation performance, a new copy is not made each time this method is invoked; instead, the contents of the array returned by this method are overwritten each time it is invoked.

    • getPopulations

      public int[] getPopulations()
      Returns the current sizes of the ecosystem breed populations.

    • getIterationCount

      public long getIterationCount()
      Returns the number of iterations performed so far in the simulation.

    • isAbsorbed

      public boolean isAbsorbed()
      Returns a flag indicating whether the simulation has reached the absorbing state, in which only one breed remains.
